qas.question: What did Darwin decide to write in July, 1858?
Which publisher did Lyell convince to arrange publication of Darwin's work?
What did the publisher offer Darwin in payment for the book?
What edition was the book in by the time of Darwin's death?
How much had the book earned Darwin by the time he died?

context: After the meeting, Darwin decided to write <a0_0>"an abstract of my whole work".<a0_0/> He started work on 20 July 1858, while on holiday at Sandown, and wrote parts of it from memory. Lyell discussed arrangements with publisher <a1_0>John Murray III<a1_0/>, of the publishing house John Murray, who responded immediately to Darwin's letter of 31 March 1859 with an agreement to publish the book without even seeing the manuscript, and an offer to Darwin of <a2_0>2⁄3 of the profits<a2_0/>. (eventually Murray paid £180 to Darwin for the 1st edition and by Darwin's death in 1882 the book was in its <a3_0>6th edition<a3_0/>, earning Darwin <a4_0>nearly £3000<a4_0/>.)
